properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 9:14PM MST until February 12 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Snow and Wind with Next Weather System...

.Another weather system will move through Montana and northern
Wyoming late tonight into Wednesday, bringing some snow and
strong wind to north-central Wyoming. Travel conditions could be
hazardous Wednesday morning in northern Johnson County.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two
inches, with locally higher amounts in the foothills. North wind
20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 to 45 mph.

* WHERE...Northeast Johnson County.

* WHEN...From 3 AM to noon MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute, especially along
Interstate 90 in northern Johnson County and around Buffalo.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON MST WEDNESDAY
